FuncDef:
The clock source cesacr ssm command configures an SSM level for a CES ACR clock source.
The undo clock source cesacr ssm command restores the SSM level for a CES ACR source.
By default, the SSM level is not used for clock synchronization.
CLIs: clock source cesacr slot <slotid> card <cardid> recovery-domain <domain-value> ssm { prc | ssua | ssub | sec | dnu | unk }
undo clock source cesacr slot <slotid> card <cardid> recovery-domain <domain-value> ssm

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a subcard ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies the number of the clock recovery domain from which a clock source is extracted.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8.
The value ranges from 1 to 4 of the 16 E1 subcard.The value of the former 16 interfaces of the 32 E1 subcard ranges from 1 to 4, and of the latter 16 interfaces ranges from 5 to 8.

Indicates that the SSM level is PRC (G.811 clock signal).
-

Indicates that the SSM level is SSUA (G.812 transit node clock signal).
-

Indicates that the SSM level is SSUB (G.812 local node clock signal).
-

Indicates that the SSM level is SEC.
-

Indicates that the SSM level is not used for clock synchronization.
-

Indicates that the SSM level is unknown clock synchronization quality.
-

Specify slot id.
The value is a string of 1 to 16, not case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] clock source cesacr slot 1 card 1 recovery-domain 2 ssm prc
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A synchronization status message (SSM) transmits the quality level of timing signals on a synchronous timing link. Node clocks on a synchronization network parse the SSM to obtain the quality level of an upstream clock.
Priorities of SSM levels: prc > ssua > ssub > sec > dnu
Prerequisites
Before configuring clock source attributes for the CES ACR clock recovery domain, you must configure the clock recovery domain for an E1 or a CPOS interface, and specify the configured domain as the system reference clock source.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
